H0.text: The shape of the parent ducks' feet is the most important factor determining the shape of a baby duck's foot, because ducks live near ponds and lakes and the foot shape helps them swim and walk on muddy ground.

H1.text: The temperature of the pond water is the most important factor in determining the shape of a baby duckâ€™s foot, which helps ducks swim and walk on muddy ground near ponds and lakes.

H2.text: The amount of mud in the bottom of the pond is the factor most important in determining the shape of a baby duck's foot, which helps ducks that live near ponds and lakes swim and walk on muddy ground.

H3.text: The amount of rain that fell before the duck was born is the most important factor in determining the shape of a baby duck's foot, given that ducks live near ponds and lakes and that the foot shape helps them swim and walk on muddy ground.
